item.title: Report E-2025030399
item.description:
Report E-2025030399

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-27T15:24:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-26
  • City: HIALEAH
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 12300
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 13:41 ET, XPO notified the Call Center of a cargo release and tote transfer at terminal NMF. It was reported that approximately 0.5 gallon of Chemtreat RL124B released from one 330 due to being crushed by freight stacked on top by previous terminal. The release impacted trailer #5634415 on dock #19, the tote has been transferred to the OSD area. Call Center reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are not capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site, due to the product being class 8. Call Center will proceed to dispatch a contractor to the site to complete cleanup activities and tote transfer. An ETA will be provided once it is known. CHEMTREC has been notified of the spill, report #2025022600145 was given by Charlie. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of UN2693 Chemtreat RL1248 product released impacting 48’x1’ area of the trailer floor due to improper loading. The contractors neutralized the released product and impacted surfaces with ProAlkaline, then containerized (1) 55-gallon poly drum with the oil dri, alkaline powder and wood chips. The product was transferred to a new tote and damaged tote left for waste pickup. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: 1. X-2025031087 RESPONDER ARRIVED ON SCENE IN FULL PPE TO FIND A BOX WITH A SMALL STAIN ON THE OUTSIDE OF THE PACKAGE. PACKAGE WAS CONTAINARIZED FOLLOWING THE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THEN TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. 2. X-2025031088 RESPONDER ARRIVED ON SCENE IN FULL PPE TO FIND A BOX LEAKING ONTO THE BELT AT THE DA. PACKAGE WAS CONTAINARIZED AND SPILL WAS CLEANED UP ACCORDING TO THE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET. PACKAGE WAS TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

  • Description: On 03/14/2025 hidden dangerous goods were discovered during the shipment inspection process at the DHL BCT Service Center, 420 S. Congress Avenue, Delray Beach, FL 33445 Transportation by road confirmed.

item.title: Report I-2025030038
item.description:
Report I-2025030038

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-26T21:14:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-13
  • City: MIAMI
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Global Crossing Airlines, Inc
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Global Crossing Airlines, Inc {GCXA} operates freighter services under an ACMI agreement with IBC Airways to Kingston, Jamaica and several cities inside Cuba. As of 02/15/2025, GCXA's Loadmasters; who accompany the aircraft as part of the crew, have detected several instances where Lithium Batteries were found as being undeclared in shipments prior to loading the aircraft. Since 02/15/2025, instructions from the Cargo Operations department of GCXA has been for the Loadmasters to remain vigilant and scrutinize all shipments that may be viewed as suspicious, i.e {labeling, marking on boxes, key words such as "generators" "batteries" etc) prior to loading any ULD's onboard the aircraft. On 03/13/2025, the Loadmasters working the flight scheduled for MIA-CFG-MIA, indicated at 07:08L that again {6th time since 02/15/25), Undeclared hazardous materials were found in the shipment prior to loading and consequently rejected the entire load. The instructions to the ground handler {NAS) was for them to break all the packages since the Loadmasters did not trust any items that were wrapped with black plastic shrink wrap. The Loadmasters reached out for guidance to the Cargo Operations leadership and was advised to stand firm on that decision to reject this shipment. The Loadasters instructed the ground handlers to begin inspecting the completed ULDs and eventually various items ranging from portable electric generators, undeclared car batteries to electric scooters were detected. IBC Airways were informed and eventually they cancelled the flight. The FAA CMT was informed of the events.

item.title: Report X-2025030941
item.description:
Report X-2025030941

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-25T18:19:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-12
  • City: TAMPA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ONE AIR PACKAGE WAS INSPECTED DUE DANGEROUS GOODS TRIGGERS VISIBLE ON THE OUTER BOX. THERE IS A SQUARE SHAPE CUT FROM THE BOX. THERE IS A WHITE LABEL AFFIXED INDICATING 25180WHT 5,000 MAH RPET POWER BANK WHITE. THERE IS ALSO A WHITE LABEL INDICATING REJECT REASON: ORDER CAN NOT BE SHIPPED WITH AN AIR SERVICE. UPON INSPECTION OF INNER CONTENTS THERE ARE FORTY-FIVE POWER BANKS, CAPACITY 5000MAH, 3.7V. THEY ARE IMPRINTED POWERFLEX EDF RENEWABLES. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THE PACKAGE WAS SCANNED INTO AN AIR CONTAINER BUT DID NOT MOVE IN THE AIR NETWORK.
